src/exceptions.c

00001 /*
00002  *      \file exceptions.c
00003  *              
00004  *              \brief The implementation of all exception handlers.
00005  *
00006  *              Intel's 80386 Exceptions Table
00007  *              ------------------------------
00008  *
00009  *              0            Divide error
00010  *              1            Debug exceptions
00011  *              2            Nonmaskable interrupt
00012  *              3            Breakpoint (one-byte INT 3 instruction)
00013  *              4            Overflow (INTO instruction)
00014  *              5            Bounds check (BOUND instruction)
00015  *              6            Invalid opcode
00016  *              7            Coprocessor not available
00017  *              8            Double fault
00018  *              9            (reserved)
00019  *              10           Invalid TSS
00020  *              11           Segment not present
00021  *              12           Stack exception
00022  *              13           General protection
00023  *              14           Page fault
00024  *              15           (reserved)
00025  *              16           Coprocessor error
00026  *              17-31        (reserved)
00027  *              
00028  *              \author Luciano Zemin, Nicolás Magni, Nicolás Purita
00029  */
00030 #include "../inc/exceptions.h"
00031 
00032 extern DESCR_INT idt[]; 
00033 
00034 void _divide_e_hand();
00035 void _debug_e_hand();
00036 void _nmi_e_hand();
00037 void _break_point_e_hand();
00038 void _overflow_e_hand();
00039 void _bounds_check_e_hand();
00040 void _invalid_opcode_e_hand();
00041 void _copro_unavailable_e_hand();
00042 void _double_fault_e_hand();
00043 void _invalid_tss_e_hand();
00044 void _segment_not_present_e_hand();
00045 void _stack_e_hand();
00046 void _general_protection_e_hand();
00047 void _page_fault_e_hand();
00048 void _coprocessor_e_hand();

00050 /*      
00051  *      Stack Order
00052  *
00053  *      .               0x00000000              
00054  *      .
00055  *      .
00056  *      
00057  *      ret
00058  *      edi
00059  *      esi
00060  *      ebp
00061  *      esp
00062  *      ebx
00063  *      edx
00064  *      ecx
00065  *      eax
00066  *      error
00067  *      ip
00068  *      cs      
00069  *      eflags
00070  *      
00071  *      .
00072  *      .
00073  *      .               0xFFFFFFFF
00074  *
00075  */
00076 typedef struct registers {
00077         unsigned edi;
00078         unsigned esi;
00079         unsigned ebp;
00080         unsigned esp;
00081         unsigned ebx;
00082         unsigned edx;
00083         unsigned ecx;
00084         unsigned eax;
00085         unsigned error;
00086         unsigned eip;
00087         unsigned cs;
00088         unsigned eflags;
00089 } registers_t;
00090 
00091 /*
00092  *      Prints the KERNEL PANIC message and
00093  *      the message given.
00094  */
00095 static void panic(char *msg, registers_t regs) {
00096         puts((const char *)"--------------------------------------------------------------------------------");
00097         puts((const char *)" KERNEL PANIC (");
00098         puts((const char *)msg);
00099         puts((const char *)") \n");
00100 
00101         puts((const char *)" Failing Instruction at: ");
00102         putx(regs.cs);
00103         puts((const char *)":");
00104         putx(regs.eip);
00105         puts((const char *)"\n\n");
00106 
00107         puts((const char *)" Registers: \n");
00108         puts((const char *)"     eax: ");
00109         putx(regs.eax); 
00110         puts((const char *)"\n");
00111         puts((const char *)"     ebx: ");
00112         putx(regs.ebx);
00113         puts((const char *)"\n");
00114         puts((const char *)"     ecx: ");
00115         putx(regs.ecx);
00116         puts((const char *)"\n");
00117         puts((const char *)"     edx: ");
00118         putx(regs.edx);
00119         puts((const char *)"\n");
00120         puts((const char *)"     esp: ");
00121         putx(regs.esp);
00122         puts((const char *)"\n");
00123         puts((const char *)"     ebp: ");
00124         putx(regs.ebp);
00125         puts((const char *)"\n");
00126         puts((const char *)"     esi: ");
00127         putx(regs.esi);
00128         puts((const char *)"\n");
00129         puts((const char *)"     edi: ");
00130         putx(regs.edi);
00131         puts((const char *)"\n");
00132         puts((const char *)"\n");
00133         return;
00134 }
00135 
00136 void handleException(registers_t regs) {
00137         pid_t pid;
00138         puts((const char *)"--------------------------------------------------------------------------------");
00139         
00140         pid = getpid();
00141         kill(pid);
00142         signalTty(getFocusedTTY());
00143         refreshTTY();
00144         while(1){
00145                 asm volatile("hlt");
00146         }
00147                 
00148         return;
00149 }
00150 
00151 void divideExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00152         panic("Divide Error", regs);
00153         handleException(regs);
00154         return;
00155 }
00156 
00157 void debugExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00158         panic("Debug Error", regs);
00159         handleException(regs);
00160         return;
00161 }
00162 
00163 void NMIExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00164         panic("Nonmaskable Interrupt Error", regs);
00165         handleException(regs);
00166         return;
00167 }
00168 
00169 void breakPointExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00170         panic("Break Point", regs);
00171         handleException(regs);
00172         return;
00173 }
00174 
00175 void overflowExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {

00177         handleException(regs);
00178         return;
00179 }

00181 void boundsCheckExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00182         panic("Bounds Check Error", regs);
00183         handleException(regs);
00184         return;
00185 }

00196         return;

00223 void generalProtectionExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {

00228 
00229 void pageFaultExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00230         unsigned address;
00231         panic("Page Fault", regs);
00232 
00233         asm volatile("mov %%cr2, %0": "=r"(address));
00234         puts((const char *)" Trying to access address ");
00235         putx(address);
00236         puts((const char *)"\n\n");
00237         puts((const char *)" Fault Info: \n");
00238         if ( (regs.error & 0x1) )
00239                 puts((const char *)"     1 - The fault was caused by a page-level protection violation.\n");
00240         else
00241                 puts((const char *)"     1 - The fault was caused by a non-present page.\n");
00242 
00243         if ( (regs.error & 0x2) )
00244                 puts((const char *)"     2 - The access causing the fault was write.\n");
00245         else
00246                 puts((const char *)"     2 - The access causing the fault was read.\n");
00247 
00248         if ( (regs.error & 0x4) )
00249                 puts((const char *)"     3 - The access causing the fault oriented when the processor was executing in user mode.\n");
00250         else
00251                 puts((const char *)"     3 - The access causing the fault oriented when the processor was executing in kernel mode.\n");
00252 
00253         if ( (regs.error & 0x8) )
00254                 puts((const char *)"     4 - The fault was caused by reserved bits set to 1 in page directory.\n");
00255         else
00256                 puts((const char *)"     4 - The fault was not caused by reserved bits violation.\n");
00257 
00258         handleException(regs);
00259         return;
00260 }
00261 
00262 void coprocessorExceptionHandler(registers_t regs) {
00263         panic("Coprocessor Error", regs);
00264         return;
00265 }

00267 /*
00268  *      TODO Check wich one of the interrupt requires
00269  *      that a singal to the pic must be send.

00272 
00273 void loadExceptionHandlers() {
00274         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x00], 0x08, (dword)&_divide_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00275         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x01], 0x08, (dword)&_debug_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00276         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x02], 0x08, (dword)&_nmi_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00277         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x03], 0x08, (dword)&_break_point_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00278         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x04], 0x08, (dword)&_overflow_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00279         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x05], 0x08, (dword)&_bounds_check_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00280         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x06], 0x08, (dword)&_invalid_opcode_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00281         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x07], 0x08, (dword)&_copro_unavailable_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00282         /*//setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x08], 0x08, (dword)&_double_fault_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0); 
00283         //setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0xA0], 0x08, (dword)&_invalid_tss_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0); */
00284         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x0B], 0x08, (dword)&_segment_not_present_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00285         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x0C], 0x08, (dword)&_stack_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00286         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x0D], 0x08, (dword)&_general_protection_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00287         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x0E], 0x08, (dword)&_page_fault_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00288         setup_IDT_entry (&idt[0x10], 0x08, (dword)&_coprocessor_e_hand, ACS_INT, 0);
00289 }
